document.description: If you like local brew pubs this is the place to go ... They also serve ice cream and pasta ... Very good hot dogs in an aviation theme fast food restaurant.

Most Recent Restaurants in Cedar Rapids All Mexican (4) Steakhouse (4) Deli (2) Italian (2) Pub/Brewery (2) Barbecue (1) Buffet (1) Coffeehouse (1) Fast Food (1) French (1) Japanese/Sushi (1) Local Food (1) Asia Pacific (1) Pizza (1) Sort by: Most recent | Most helpful Write a Review Cedar Brewing Company: Cedar Rapids' Brew Pub
Helpfulness Jewelslover 108 reviews If you like local brew pubs this is the place to go, they have the usual wheat's, ale's and stouts. There are usually limited time special beers as well. They even brew their own cream soda!
They have good food too. The regular bar and grill type items - salads, sandwichs, etc.
The atmosphere is that of a sports bar, there are lots of tv's to watch the game on. The restaurant is pretty new and looks nice inside and out.
Favorite Dish: The chicken fingers were good.
Updated May 15, 2005
Address : 500 Blairs Ferry Rd NE
Phone : 319-378-9090
Website : www.cedarbrewing.com
Was this review helpful?
Happy Joe's Pizza: Happy Joe's Pizza is Mmmm Good!!!
Helpfulness Jewelslover 108 reviews Happy Joe's Pizza has always been a favorite of mine. Mostly because I love the Happy Joe's Special - Canadian Bacon and Sauerkraut. That's right - Sauerkraut!!! But they also have your usual pizza's including taco pizza. They also serve ice cream and pasta.
Updated May 15, 2005
Address : 5070 Lindale Drive, NE
Phone : 319-393-0017
Website : http://happyjoes.com/locations/cedarrapids2/
Was this review helpful?
Bishop's Cafeteria: Bishop's Chocolate Ambrosia Pie Mmmmm
Helpfulness Jewelslover 108 reviews Bishop's is another one of those restaurants that's been around forever. I remember eating here as a little girl. They have everything from fried chicken to baked fish to swiss steak to ham, and all of the fixin's on the side, veggies, and rolls. But what they are really known for are their desserts, and if you love chocolate try the Chocolate Ambrosia pie.
Favorite Dish: The Chocolate Ambrosia pie has a graham cracker crust, has a thick, sort of whipped chocolate pudding layer on the bottom, then a thick whipped topping layer topped with chocolate shavings. You'll definately be back for this pie!
Written May 14, 2005
Address : 2600 Edgewood Rd SW
Phone : 319-396-4266
Was this review helpful?
Little King: Locals Favorite Sub Sandwiches!
Helpfulness Jewelslover 108 reviews This place has been around probably longer than I have. It's a local favorite and probably the best sub sandwich I've ever had! The Little King Special is the best.
The restaurant is primarily used by people working in downtown Cedar Rapids for lunch, so has limited hours of business:
Monday through Friday 10:00am-2:30pm.
Written May 14, 2005
Address : 211 2nd Street SE
Phone : (319) 363-9695
Was this review helpful?
Bistro on First: Classy Art, Awesome Food
Helpfulness mgarver 1 reviews This is one of the snazziest that Cedar Rapids has to offer. Located right along the river in downtown, the restaurant has an unassuming face. The bar is beautiful, dim, and cozy; perfect for small chat and intimate pre-dinner drinks. The main dining room features old brick walls, but has funky cutting edge lighting features for all the eclectic Matisse and Picasso style art. If there is an unfavorable aspect to the restaurant, it is that the menu has remained unchanged in it's several years of business. Though some consider that a GOOD thing!
Favorite Dish: The entrees I have had are the mango citrus salmon and the pepper beef tenderloin, and both were flavorful. The chefs there have a great sense of flavor nuances and mix them well...definitely not your hum-drum-run of the mill meat and potatoes that are so prevalent in midwestern towns. But the best are the creme brulees. Warm, creamy, and sweet, the crust is perfectly reminiscent of toasted marshmellows in its flavor, and of smooth hard candy in texture.
Written Nov 1, 2003
Address : 401 First Street going south off of I 380
Phone : 319-862-2062 Related to: Romantic Travel and Honeymoons Food and Dining Wine Tasting Was this review helpful?
I really like the Tick Tock,...
Helpfulness natdog 2 reviews I really like the Tick Tock, near Daniels Park. It has a lot of atmosphere, and cool pictures on the walls. Also, I'm a big fan of Vitos on 42nd Street, good place to see some friends! Also, go to the Irish democrat.
Written Aug 26, 2002
Was this review helpful?
North Country Steakhouse: Cook your own steak
Helpfulness Jim_Eliason 3971 reviews This place has a unique concept in that it is set up like a butcher's shop and you select your cut of meat. From there, they provide marinades and grills for you to cook your own steak.
Updated Apr 4, 2011
Address : 1140 Blairs Ferry Rd. NE
Phone : 319.378.BEEF Related to: Food and Dining Was this review helpful?
Biaggis: Upscale Italian
Helpfulness Jim_Eliason 3971 reviews Upscale Italian restaurant in the Lindale Mall area.
Updated Apr 4, 2011
Address : 320 Collins Road NE
Phone : (319) 393-6593 Related to: Food and Dining Was this review helpful?
Vino's Ristorante: The Italian Place
Helpfulness Jewelslover 108 reviews Classic nice Italian Restaurant. Check out their website for menu.
Updated Sep 9, 2006
Address : 3611 First Ave SE, Cedar Rapids, IA
Phone : (319) 363-7550
Website : http://vinosristorante.com/index.html
Was this review helpful?
The Flying Weenie: Good hot dogs! Oatlad 43 reviews Very good hot dogs in an aviation theme fast food restaurant. Limited seating, but that's not why you go there. Its the dogs.
Favorite Dish: Hot dogs.
Written Mar 15, 2006
Address : 103 8 Av SW
Phone : (319) 861-3036 Related to: Business Travel Budget Travel Road Trip Was this review helpful?

Q: Are there any restaraunts in C.R. that are big enough to handle 30-40 people and have good menu and live music?
A: Well, Lonestar doesn't have live music, but it's good. Long Branch is something to check out as well...it does have live music. There are many good large restaurants in...

Cedar Rapids, Iowa - New Pics, Check Travelogues

Jim_Eliason's Cedar Rapids Page

A great place to visit
I recently spent a week in Cedar Rapids, Iowa helping a friend out with the Variety Club telethon.

My home town
I was born in Cedar Rapids and lived there until 2001. My folks still live there, and I have a few good friends there, so I go back to visit at least once a year.

yeah quaker oats!!
